original: NORDWALL, Adolf Birger, Civilingenjör, Borås, f Gävle 18/10 07 av stationsskriv Joh Ad N o Anna Dahlin, gm Maud Malmstedt. Studex Gävle 26, civingex KTH (maskinbyggn o mek tekn) 30, utbildn i tidn.typografi i Kphmn 29, resestip fr KTH 33, Iving (fänrik) 43. Privatassist åt prof W Weibull v lab f maskinelement v KTH 30, bl a för artilleristiska undersökn f Arméförvaltn :s Tygdep; driftsing v Borås Wäfveri AB 31—32, planeringschef där sed. 32. Resor: Tyskl, Holl, Tjeckoslov, Danm o Norge 29 o 36. Förf reseberätt ang driftstekn o ekon frågor inom bomulls-textilind i Tyskl, Holl o Tjeckoslov. Led av Sv Tekn.frn, Tekn Frb i Borås, STF, Borås skyttefrn o Frn f Olymp Kortdistansskytte. Pistolskyttemärke g, skyttemärke s, skidl.märke br o duellpistol br. Hobbies: Skytte, foto, friluftsliv.
translated: NORDWALL, Adolf Birger, Civil Engineer, Borås, b. Gävle 18/10 07, son of stationmaster Johan Adolf Nordwall and Anna Dahlin, m. Maud Malmstedt. Graduated from Gävle (high school) in 1926, civil engineering degree from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) specializing in mechanical engineering in 1930, trained in newspaper typography in Copenhagen in 1929, travel grant from KTH in 1933, commissioned officer (Ensign) in 1943. Private assistant to Professor W. Weibull in the laboratory for machine elements at KTH from 1930, involved in artillery investigations for the Army Administration's Arsenal Department; worked as a technician at Borås Wäfveri AB from 1931-1932, became planning manager there from 1932 onward. Traveled to Germany, the Netherlands, Czechoslovakia, Denmark, and Norway in 1929 and 1936. Authored travel reports on technical and economic aspects within the cotton textile industry in Germany, the Netherlands, and Czechoslovakia. Member of the Swedish Technical Association, Engineering Association in Borås, Swedish Tourism Association, Borås Shooting Association, and the Olympic Short Distance Shooting Association. Awarded a shooting medal and a marksmanship badge for pistol shooting, and bronze level for skiing. Hobbies include shooting, photography, and outdoor activities.

publications.name: Travel Reports on Technical and Economic Aspects within the Cotton Textile Industry
publications.description: Reports focusing on Germany, the Netherlands, and Czechoslovakia

awards.name: Marksmanship Badge (Pistol Shooting)
awards.description: Awarded for marksmanship in pistol shooting

career.workplace: Laboratory for Machine Elements at KTH
